intro: Monnina ligustrifolia, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. It has heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Monnina ligustrifolia is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
